channel.title: nlin.AO updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: nlin.AO updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Birth, Death, and Horizontal Flight: Malthusian flocks with an easy plane in three dimensions
item.description: arXiv:2407.03071v3 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: I formulate the theory of three dimensional "Malthusian flocks" -- i.e., coherently moving collections of self-propelled entities (such as living creatures) which are being "born" and "dying" during their motion -- whose constituents all have a preference for having their velocity vectors lie parallel to the same two-dimensional plane. I determine the universal scaling exponents characterizing such systems exactly, finding that the dynamical exponent $z=3/2$, the "anisotropy" exponent $\zeta=3/4$, and the "roughness" exponent $\chi=-1/2$. I also give the scaling laws implied by these exponents.
item.dc:creator: John Toner
